intro: Impatiens pinganoensis, commonly known as the Pingano impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant is herbaceous, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found growing in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
